website_summaries.verdict: HP shakes up the world of gaming laptops with unique-looking and highly portable Omen. It offers very capable performance in PC games, despite being stuck with a last-gen graphics card.
pros: The HP Omen has a bold design, plenty of user customization options, a great keyboard, and something often missing from gaming laptops, a touchscreen
cons: The screen resolution is capped at 1080p, while the competition goes up to 4K
Routing all the ports and heat vents to the rear won't appeal to everyone, and the only graphics card available is decidedly mid-tier

customer_reviews.title: Unique and Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Laptop as advertised. fans are not as loud as some say. keyboard and touchpad work fine. Although I find the touchpad to be a bit sensitive. takes getting used to. I feel the blue exhaust hinges take away from the sleekness of this laptop, but that's just my opinion. Touch screen works well, but the screen itself sometimes has a vibrating effect that could annoy some. I like the ports in the back but the power cord tends to fall out of the port a lot, as it isn't very snug when plugged in. Battery life is going to be a knock but when in power save mode there really isn't any issues. 5/5 worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for Money Laptop
customer_reviews.text: this computer is very nicely designed and built. The looks and feel of it is better than any other laptop I've seen. I got it for around 1000$, 8gb RAM, 256 SSD, GTX860 2gb VRAM, and it is one of the best value for money gaming laptop out there; add to it the quality and great design and I would say it is THE best. some people have complained about screen flicker but that never happened to me, thankfully. I definitly recommend it to anyone even if not for gaming use, it is an overall great machine with very fast booting/loading times at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulrahman Omar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome laptop, had it for over a year now and it is great for gaming, office, travel.
customer_reviews.author: Samir Djogic

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a few weeks and am pleased with its performance thus far. It appears to be built well with plenty of ports and a nice touch screen. I cannot compare to other current laptops but compared to my 4 year old HP laptop, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop for Work, School, and Gaming on the Go
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, good for light gaming on the go. Touchscreen works well. Nice aesthetics, not stereo typically "gamer" appearance with garish colors and designs. Only downsides are that it does get hot easier than I expected and it won't run games at super ultra high graphics smoothly, but that one was expected.
customer_reviews.author: Me Me I'm a Tan Man

customer_reviews.title: The overall laptop feels great the keyboard and trackpad are responsive
customer_reviews.text: I just own this laptop for a couple of days and boy was surprised, I wasn't even so sure that HP made this. The overall laptop feels great the keyboard and trackpad are responsive, love the lighting and speakers too. One thing that bothered me is that the keyboard is shifted to the right because of the macros keys. But I'll get used to it in not time, over all a great laptop 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Benchelle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Gaming Performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with everything about this laptop. Only flaw I can find is the moronic design to put the fans at the bottom of the laptop with little to no way for the laptop to breath so extremely uncomfortable on for actual lap usage. I know I can get a cooling surface, or simply a stand, but it's the principle of the thing. Still an incredible laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop, Great Desing
customer_reviews.text: Great Laptop, Great Desing! But a few things can be improved! +Full HD High DPI Screen (Gorgeous) Feels almost like 4K. - Weak spearkers (beats). +Keyboard (colors). - Fan noise (sometimes). +Touch screen. - Right speaker light fails sometimes. +Fast. - Little Pricey +Decent (medium to high or ultra) gaming. + Quality finish.
customer_reviews.author: Jgerlant

customer_reviews.title: Love this laptop!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is gorgeous, and the specs are sick. No regrets in buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Dantrassy

customer_reviews.title: Such a bad ass laptop
customer_reviews.text: Such a bad ass laptop.. Would give it 5 stars but every week or so, the touch screen will freak out(even tho I never use it) and act like its being "touched" a million times.. Can't click or close anything, just have to close the laptop and wait a few seconds, then reboot and it seems to be fine..
customer_reviews.author: Chase Corder

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My son got it for college and he is very impressed with the speed. Also loves the look. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Yes it did. The only complaint was it came with Windows 8 with no free upgrade to Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: shawn m young

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: A very premium looking piece of hardware; I dont't think the battery's performance will be competing though.
customer_reviews.author: M A.Hussein

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine -- Battery Sucks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine, but the battery sucks and the keyboard/light software just doesn't work well. Update: 4 years later, the battery finally died. It was pretty easy to replace other than then critical rubber strips that elevate the bottom of the laptop so that the fans can work. :( Update (ethernet): I finally just noticed (2018) that my ethernet connection with the supplier dongle was only 100Mbps. I ordered a new USB3 adapter for $20 and to my surprise, the connection jumped up to 307Mbps (my max). Get rid of your original and upgrade for sure. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: D-Mambo

customer_reviews.title: Great computer!!
customer_reviews.text: We use it a lot for surfing online. Super quick!!! Crisp display too. I should have bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: keith foy

customer_reviews.title: I love this laptop
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. It's slim, powerful, full lighting control (except for the back exhaust port which is annoying), can play games at usually medium-low settings. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey T.

customer_reviews.title: Speed Thrills
customer_reviews.text: Finally the speed of the internet connection is my only limitation and not the flu.
customer_reviews.author: Rex D. Roberts, PhD

customer_reviews.title: I would have loved it. Instant return
customer_reviews.text: Epic Fail with the Touchscreen HP. Phantom or ghost tapping makes the touchscreen absolutely unusable. I didn't expect to pay $1500 for a possessed laptop. And I just spent four hours downloading all my software for work and play. Otherwise, I would have loved it. Instant return. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Missrepresentation

customer_reviews.title: very good, the only thing that is not good enough ...
customer_reviews.text: very good, the only thing that is not good enough is, HP doesn't come with three finger drags. while Apple mac come with that. also, the HP omen control doesn't work sometimes. Also, HP need to increase the brightness a lot. For it is not bright enough to see things comfortably. plus, the p1 to p6 key are useless. The overall is great, i like it!
customer_reviews.author: TheGreatOne

customer_reviews.title: beware
customer_reviews.text: like the computer at first but the screen started jumping and flickering and took over the computer was unable to do anything with it after fighting with it for several days i was going to send it back but it was a great computer,, after a tech spend several hours with it and i spent more money on it .....it now runs great with no jumping nor takeover it was like the computer was possessed and would let me do anything even turn it off , so beware
customer_reviews.author: leeanna clark

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly potent gaming machine.
customer_reviews.text: This HP Omen 15 is a surprisingly potent gaming machine with features you might not normally expect from a mainstream PC manufacturer including customizable keyboard backlighting and revved-up storage. Pro's are: PCI-connected storage offers faster performance than SATA-based competition Touch screen Programmable macro buttons Customizable keyboard backlighting Con's are: Rear-mounted ports are inconvenient Ethernet requires adapter dongle All in all a very decent notebook but would definitely recommend checking out this Acer as a comparison:
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: bad laptop
customer_reviews.text: Purchased at Best Buy as an open box item I was quite excited to bring this laptop home. The 3D graphics on it look great, but then a problem began happening. 3D graphics and the discrete GPU just suddenly stopped working, the service battery alert started popping up and the machine is just behaving very slowly even though I have only installed chrome and eSet security. The power cable in the back is way too easy to knock out and easy to break, These cylinder power cables are despicable
customer_reviews.author: Thetek Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Good performance laptop
customer_reviews.text: Very fast. Very hot. Can be loud. Runs Win 10 easily. I recommend buying a cooling pad with a fan if you're going to work with the computer on your lap. I can see how some people might complain about the noise and heat. But the reality is that a computer with this much power is going to produce a significant amount of heat. The fan noise doesn't bother me and I don't think it's excessive, but I wouldnt call it quiet.
customer_reviews.author: matthew k

customer_reviews.title: The screen and everything on it is awesome. While it's two years old it still runs ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this laptop. The screen and everything on it is awesome. While it's two years old it still runs everything I throw at it and more. Will hold onto this a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was very interested in buying one of these and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very interested in buying one of these and was on the phone with HP and very close to closing the deal.. and I asked the sales rep if I could upgrade the ram on this laptop HP told me yes... I guess they lied to me
customer_reviews.author: igor

customer_reviews.title: ... running 2 Terra's on my desk and it's usually pretty loaded to gills on software
customer_reviews.text: Lets get real folks a gaming laptop with ok specs but no real storage space as an avid gamer I currently am running 2 Terra's on my desk and it's usually pretty loaded to gills on software. The 250 gigs is deplorable I don't want to buy a machine for that much that imediately needs an upgrade. No thanks I'll head elsewhere for my next laptop purchase
customer_reviews.author: monte

customer_reviews.title: I have never used this before, however I am ...
customer_reviews.text: I have never used this before, however I am looking into computer and computer specks... my laptop is HP 500 + GB of harddrive space, came with 5 GB of ram, intel core I5, intel graphics 400 or something... BUT THIS COMPUTER IS OVERPRICED
customer_reviews.author: yehuda lowenthal
